name: The Cumberland Plateau: A Pride and Prejudice Modern Sequel
categories: Novel's plot and characters in modern setting
Story set in U.S. Deep South
author: M. K. Baxley (Meg Evenstar)
description:
Separated by circumstances beyond their control, two brothers make a promise. John Bennet, the elder brother of Jane Austen's beloved Mr. Bennet is forced to leave England, but before he departs, he vows to his brother that their family will someday be united. Two hundred years later, Dr. Fitzwilliam Darcy II, takes a teaching position at a small university. He is not expecting to find a woman who captivates him as the beautiful Elizabeth Bennett does, nor does he have any idea that she is descended from a lost branch of his family. They meet and fall in love, but will his aristocratic family and elite world of privilege accept her?
Fitzwilliam's younger brother, David, is a man scarred by his past. He has no desire for love, marriage, or family life until he meets a beautiful corporate executive from Charleston , South Carolina . She turns his world upside down as she haunts his dreams and waking moments almost from the beginning of their acquaintance. As the brothers face numerous challenges, will they be able to keep the women they love?
While her brothers toil with their lives, Georgiana Darcy seeks a love of her own with a USMC captain fighting in Iraq . Will her young Marine come back to her or will he be a hero and lose his life in heroic pursuit? Georgiana Darcy keeps the faith on the home front as she proves to be a young woman of strength and principle.
Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice continues with this modern day sequel. Set in the mountains of Tennessee , The Cumberland Plateau is a story of innocence and purity, reckless desire and abandonment, love and betrayal, faith and hope, and family heritage and pride. It is a story of strong men and the women who loved them as they struggle to become the men they were born to be.
In this tale of Pride and Prejudice, the character of the original Mr. Darcy is split between two brothers--his descendants. This is their story.
Some scenes mature.

name: Dana Darcy
author: M. K. Baxley (Meg Evenstar)
description:
Dana Darcy is a Southern Gothic tale of Pride and Prejudice set in London England and Charleston, South Carolina. It is told in two parts.
 Part One begins in London, England. Fitzwilliam Darcy and his wife, the former Elizabeth Bennett of Tennessee, discover a lost and lonely child who bears a strong resemblance to his mother, Anne Darcy. 
Two months before his marriage in The Cumberland Plateau, David Darcy had one last encounter with his long time lover Sandra Hamilton. In an attempt to leave Cecilia Lawton, the woman who held claim to his heart, behind, David called his former girlfriend, but when he realized that she had become emotionally attached, he broke off their relationship never to return again. Seven years have passed and once again Sandra will reenter his life, this time with a little girl. As Sandra lies dying, will David come, and more importantly, will he love and except the daughter he never knew existed? 
 Part Two of Dana Darcy opens in Charleston, South Carolina set in the rich culture and tradition of the Gullah people, former slaves of the rice and cotton planters on the Sea Islands and Coastal Plains of South Carolina and Georgia. Against the will of those who tried to conquer them, they have held on to their ways � ways little understood and many greatly feared. 
An old family curse has haunted the Lawton family of Lowcountry since 1820. With her marriage to David Darcy of London, England, and the subsequent birth of their three sons, Cecilia Lawton thought the curse to be broken. But is it really, and more importantly, who placed the curse and why? 
As things begin to unravel, an aging Root Doctor, Peter Morgan, finds himself pressed back into service as he tried to learn the truth of the strange happenings within the family he loves and works for. A snake, a cat, and a blood rose. What do they mean? 
Enjoy the interactions of the English and American Darcys and their children when you enter the paranormal world of hoodoo and black magic as The Cumberland Plateau continues in the sequel, Dana Darcy. 
This novel contains Christian elements with Spiritual Warfare. It is not a romance novel, but rather a paranormal mystery and a story of love, forgiveness, and redemption. It contains some violence and should be rated PG13.

author: Colin (cpodom)
description: When Darcy decides to propose to Elizabeth, the sequence of events is modified by the appearance of Col. Fitzwilliam at the Parsonage. He has followed Darcy after he left Rosings, and he arrives just outside the house in time to hear angry voices through the window. After hearing Elizabeth tell Darcy that she could never have accepted the man who had ruined the hope of happiness for her sister, he enters unannounced and opened the door to the front room just in time to hear Elizabeth charge Darcy with being the cause of Wickham's misfortunes. Col. Fitzwilliam cannot stop himself from intervening over this misunderstanding, and the rest of the disastrous proposal never takes place. Even though Darcy and Elizabeth flee from the room, Col. Fitzwilliam discovers that Elizabeth will be staying in London, and he is determined that this error regarding Wickham cannot be allowed to stand.

name: Letters
author: Marj
description:
Jane and Bingley are blissfully engaged: Darcy has proposed to Elizabeth a second time and has been accepted. After a little incredulity on the part of her family, they settle down to wait out their engagement period. This time is unfortunately longer than is perhaps the accepted norm, as the wedding is to be a double one with Jane and Bingley. Also, because of the haste and conjecture that accompanied the wedding of Mr and Mrs Bennet's youngest daughter, an extended engagement of four months waiting is considered prudent and agreed to by the brides' wise and cautious parents. The young couples are to make their vows on the Day of St Valentine, February 14th, 18__.
Unfortunately, Mr Darcy does not reside within Hertfordshire and he has many arrangements to make before his nuptials. He is required to absent himself from his affianced for quite considerable amounts of time during their betrothal period. This is the history of that time as represented through their correspondence. Although we know our young couple will weather this period, this season of courtship is not an easy one. Much of the pleasure expected is diminished by separation and by the mortifying connections of each. They still have many hurdles and misunderstandings to overcome; how do they ever make it to their wedding day?

categories: Darcy and Elizabeth anticipate their vows
author: MariaFaith
description:
When Elizabeth Bennet refuses his hand, Darcy is devastated and makes it his mission to change. By every civility in his power, Darcy slowly tries to win her affections, but Elizabeth is not easily swayed. Darcy vows to unlock the secrets that will make her his. He curses himself for his social awkwardness and appearance of pride, and sets out to right the wrongs he's done her family.

Elizabeth's family and friends misunderstand his intentions, and being in Elizabeth's presence proves to be both excruciating for the shy Darcy-and a dream come true. For the first time in his life, he must please a woman worth having, and the transformation leads him to a depth of understanding and love that he never could have imagined.

name: My Dearest Mr Darcy: An Amazing Journey into Love Everlasting
categories: Sequels centering on Darcy and Elizabeth
author: Sharon Lathan
description:
The quest to meld as one is realized. The two have become one soul, and together they travel down the pathway of life. The tale of matrimonial happily-ever-after began in Two Shall Become One ~ Mr. and Mrs. Fitzwilliam Darcy and continued in Journeys Beyond Pemberley and now recommences in The Darcys at Year's End.

Elizabeth and Darcy have been married nine bliss-filled months when our story resumes. Happily ensconced at Pemberley, they await the birth of their first child with beloved family and friends surrounding. It is a period of peace and anticipation, with a number of adventures, as time marches toward both their first anniversary and the end of the chronological year.

Join our favorite couple as their relationship reaches new heights with each passing day, as they vacation at the seaside, as they welcome their firstborn, as they celebrate their anniversary and second Christmas as a family, and as they at every turn embrace the love gifted to them.

author: Annette (2) (rainbowpromise)
description: So, we are at this flashy summer resort, and Lizzy is the girl, who came here once as a guest, never to leave - being dumped there with no money and pregnant. She is now what is nowadays considered undesirable: single mother with unfinished education, on social pay, adding to her budget by cleaning at the hotel. She is full of life and love for her kid though, making herself a happy life.She also cleans a room of one Fitzwilliam Darcy, a guest who is the only one staying always at his hotel room and staring at her as she works, but not saying a word. She rather dislikes his silent disapproving attitude toward her station in life and distrust towards her to do her work in his room properly without his supervision.But one day something happens, which makes her reassess him...

Follow the men as they wander through the P&P events and a few new events of their own making.
